Description: Corroded iron small hatchet- or adze-head or chisel blade (?) used for carpentry, with a rectangular blade with rectangular cross-section and a narrow tang of square cross-section, which was clearly fastened in a mortise at one end of a wooden haft.
Curator's comments: "Broad form of wooden chisel (...) shown on fig. 22", mentioned byW.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 22
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 22)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.76, p.184, pl.26)
Condition: Corroded and incomplete (one corner of the cutting edge missing)
